news.title: ZIFA presidential aspirant Temba Mliswa withdraws appeal
news.content:
Story by Fungai Jachi
Disqualified ZIFA presidential aspirant Temba Mliswa has withdrawn his application to stop elections set for this Saturday.
Mliswa and the respondents concurred that the application was ill-timed.

news.title: High Court to hear aspiring ZIFA presidential candidate Mliswa’s application
news.content:
Story by Fungai Jachi
THE High Court is set to hear an application made by aspiring ZIFA presidential candidate Temba Mliswa this Tuesday.
Mliswa is among the five candidates who were disqualified by the ZIFA Electoral Committee after falling short of the association’s eligibility criteria.

news.title: Gidiza appointed Dynamos team manager
news.content:
Story by Lawrence Trusida, Sports Editor
Former Warriors midfielder, Ronald ‘Gidiza’ Sibanda has been appointed Dynamos team manager for the 2025 season.
Sibanda who made his name at Zimbabwe Saints, turned out for Dembare between 1998 and 1999, before taking his talents elsewhere.

news.title: Harbin 2025 Asian Winter Games torch lit
news.content:
Story by Vivian Bangamu
This Monday, the flame for the Harbin 2025 Asian Winter Games was lit at the Sun Island Scenic Area in Harbin City, northeast China’s Heilongjiang Province, with 0nly 18 days to go before the opening of the Games.
Nine flame collectors guarded the torch, symbolizing the ninth edition of the Games, before it was collected.
The flame, which was ignited by the sun’s rays through an artificial ice lens, was then presented to the public by Xu Qin, head of the Heilongjiang Provincial Committee of the Communist Party of China.
After the display, Xu handed over the torch to flame guards who transferred the flame to a flame lantern, which represents that the torch relay is about to start in the coming days.
An online torch relay was also launched during the flame collection event.
Harbin last hosted the games in 1996, making this year the second timed they will host the Games.

news.title: DeMbare confirms MaBlanyo
news.content: Story by Lawrence Trusida, Sports Editor
